title: Sri Lanka receives 40,000MT of petrol under Indian credit line
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka received a 40,000 metric tonne consignment of petrol on Monday (23) under an Indian credit facility, the Indian High Commission in Colombo said.
“Commitment delivered!! Around 40000 MT of petrol under #Indian assistance reached #Colombo today,” the offical Twitter handle of the Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka said.
Commitment delivered!! Around 40000 MT of petrol under #Indian assistance reached #Colombo today. pic.twitter.com/3pz0zKKKcP
On May 21, another 40,000 MT of diesel reached the Sri Lankan waters from India.
India extended a fuel credit line to the island by 200 million dollars which allowed the country to import four fuel shipments from India.
Three shipments have arrived already. A diesel cargo on May 15 and May 21st reached Colombo.
Another 500 million US dollars credit line for fuel from India too is under discussion. (Colombo/May23/2022)
